snippet: The East River Ferry service is in the second year of a $9 million subsidies contract with New York City, but questions remain about its chances for profitability.
abstract: New York Waterway's East River Ferry service is in the second year of a three-year contract with New York City, but questions remain about its chances for profitability once $9 million in subsidies expire; number of riders on the seven-stop service is growing, but it is not yet apparent that ferries can become a daily habit for enough people to keep the ferry from losing money.
lead_paragraph: The East River Ferry service is in the second year of a $9 million subsidies contract with New York City, but questions remain about its chances for profitability.

headline.seo: East River Ferry Service Hopes Lovely Commute Brings It Self Reliance
headline.main: Hoping to Lure Riders With Scenic Commutes
headline.print_headline: Hoping to Lure Riders With Scenic Commutes
